content:
Hey! This discussion started in #redesign project > alert words , but posting here for broader feedback. @Vlad Korobov FYI

We realized that we need to decide on the redesigned colors for highlighting alert words and search matches. Thoughts on these options?

pink1_dark.png pink1_light.png

orange_dark.png orange_light.png

pink2_dark.png pink2_light.png

For context, we'll be using purple for personal mention pills and green for group mention pills:

image.png

The current colors are yellow for search words (which is pretty standard) and green for alert words, but I don't think we need to feel tied to that.
/poll Which color?
pink1_dark shows dark messages on a light background; is that intentional?

Anders Kaseorg said:

pink1_dark shows dark messages on a light background; is that intentional?

it is just a legend
Okay. The background color has a lot of impact on perceived contrast though. We’d get better feedback from comparing the colors in their proper context.
The dark theme has dark messages and light theme has light. You have all the possible examples there

I think the point Anders is making is that the overall background of pink1_dark.png is a light color, and that that makes it hard to accurately gauge how those colors would look in real life when the overall background is dark.

"it is hard to accurately gauge how colors would look in real life"
Agree, that is why we test things in real life on zulip chat.

The choice isn't that hard. Hard pink, soft pink or orange :smile:
i guess I'm asking how alerty the alert words should be?

I think they should be pretty alerty. This is a feature people opt into when they specifically want to be alerted. I think the feature's effectiveness depends on the alert standing out pretty well even when you're skimming a bunch of messages.
(But I don't actually use this feature; feedback from people who do would be great.)

I like the orange in the light theme but not the dark theme. We want it to be alerty, but at the level of a mention, not a big red error, and I think the relatively light orange has a good level of contrast in the light theme but seems maybe too jumpy in the dark one.
here is the softer orange in the dark theme image.png
Hmm I worry that now looks red, rather than orange; I had been thinking a lighter orange color might look better.

I'm not sure what do you mean by lighter orange here are some variations:

  1. So this is a baseline, the color hue of the orange is the same but they differ by lightness and saturation:
    image.png

  2. Here in the dark version I tune the hue towards yellow in the dark version to make it not as bloody:
    image.png

  3. Here in the dark version I increase saturation and increase highness of 2. which makes it a bit harder to read because it decreases the contrast with the white font:
    image.png

  4. And here I decrease the lightness of 3. image.png
Visually (in terms of how the orange stands out and looks far enough from red to not make me feel this is an error indicator), I like option 3 best.

@Alya Abbott would you create an issue?

Colors for light theme:
Search yellow: #FFEF95
Alert orange: #FFC6AE

Colors for dark theme:
Search yellow: #756400
Alert orange: #95491E
Filed Change search and alert word highlight colors #24922.

Here is the PR of this issue #24928.
Just alert words orange is not looking the same as per design: PR vs Design.png
could there be some transparency?

Vlad Korobov said:

could there be some transparency?

There isn't much difference as such, just that with our current bluish dark theme, the orange highlight color is looking a bit pale/less vibrant than the design you shared with a black theme.(not much noticeable in the image I shared)

I see the PR now and the dark theme color is set to this:

.dark-theme:root .rendered_markdown .alert-word {
    background-color: hsl(22, 66%, 35%);
}

Lets change it to

.dark-theme:root .rendered_markdown .alert-word {
    background-color: hsl(22, 70%, 35%);
}
updated PR #24928 changed the background-color to hsl(22, 70%, 35%).
I don’t have any more comments
Thank you
